00012 
00013 int
00014 wapi_get_we_version(int sock, const char *ifname, int *we_version)
00015 {
00016     struct iwreq wrq;
00017     char buf[sizeof(struct iw_range) * 2];
00018     int ret;
00019 
00020     /* Prepare request. */
00021     bzero(buf, sizeof(buf));
00022     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00023     wrq.u.data.length = sizeof(buf);
00024     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00025 
00026     /* Get WE version. */
00027     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00028     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRANGE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00029     {
00030         struct iw_range *range = (struct iw_range *) buf;
00031         *we_version = (int) range->we_version_compiled;
00032     }
00033     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRANGE);
00034 
00035     return ret;
00036 }

00039 /*-- Frequency ---------------------------------------------------------------*/
00040 
00041 
00042 const char *wapi_freq_flags[] = {
00043     "WAPI_FREQ_AUTO",
00044     "WAPI_FREQ_FIXED"
00045 };
00046 
00047 
00048 /**
00049  * Converts internal representation of frequencies to a floating point.
00050  */
00051 static inline double
00052 wapi_freq2float(const struct iw_freq *freq)
00053 {
00054     return ((double) freq->m) * pow(10, freq->e);
00055 }
00056 
00057 
00058 /**
00059  * Converts a floating point the our internal representation of frequencies.
00060  */
00061 static inline void
00062 wapi_float2freq(double floatfreq, struct iw_freq *freq)
00063 {
00064     freq->e = (short) floor(log10(floatfreq));
00065     if (freq->e > 8)
00066     {
00067         freq->m = ((long) (floor(floatfreq / pow(10,freq->e - 6)))) * 100;
00068         freq->e -= 8;
00069     }
00070     else
00071     {
00072         freq->m = (long) floatfreq;
00073         freq->e = 0;
00074     }
00075 }
00076 
00077 
00078 int
00079 wapi_get_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double *freq, wapi_freq_flag_t *flag)
00080 {
00081     struct iwreq wrq;
00082     int ret;
00083 
00084     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00085     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWFREQ, &wrq)) >= 0)
00086     {
00087         /* Set flag. */
00088         if (IW_FREQ_AUTO == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_AUTO))
00089             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_AUTO;
00090         else if (IW_FREQ_FIXED == (wrq.u.freq.flags & IW_FREQ_FIXED))
00091             *flag = WAPI_FREQ_FIXED;
00092         else
00093         {
00094             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.freq.flags);
00095             return -1;
00096         }
00097 
00098         /* Set freq. */
00099         *freq = wapi_freq2float(&(wrq.u.freq));
00100     }
00101 
00102     return ret;
00103 }
00104 
00105 
00106 int
00107 wapi_set_freq(int sock, const char *ifname, double freq, wapi_freq_flag_t flag)
00108 {
00109     struct iwreq wrq;
00110     int ret;
00111 
00112     /* Set freq. */
00113     wapi_float2freq(freq, &(wrq.u.freq));
00114 
00115     /* Set flag. */
00116     switch (flag)
00117     {
00118     case WAPI_FREQ_AUTO:
00119         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_AUTO;
00120         break;
00121     case WAPI_FREQ_FIXED:
00122         wrq.u.freq.flags = IW_FREQ_FIXED;
00123         break;
00124     }
00125 
00126     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00127     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWFREQ, &wrq);
00128     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWFREQ);
00129 
00130     return ret;
00131 }

00143 int
00144 wapi_get_essid(
00145     int sock,
00146     const char *ifname,
00147     char *essid,
00148     wapi_essid_flag_t *flag)
00149 {
00150     struct iwreq wrq;
00151     int ret;
00152 
00153     wrq.u.essid.pointer = essid;
00154     wrq.u.essid.length = WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1;
00155     wrq.u.essid.flags = 0;
00156 
00157     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00158     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWESSID, &wrq);
00159     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWESSID);
00160     else *flag = (wrq.u.essid.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00161 
00162     return ret;
00163 }

00172 {
00173     char buf[WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1];

00175     int ret;
00176 
00177     /* Prepare request. */
00178     wrq.u.essid.pointer = buf;
00179     wrq.u.essid.length =
00180         snprintf(buf, ((WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1) * sizeof(char)), "%s", essid);
00181     wrq.u.essid.flags = (flag == WAPI_ESSID_ON);
00182 
00183     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00184     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWESSID, &wrq);
00185     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWESSID);
00186

00205 static int
00206 wapi_parse_mode(int iw_mode, wapi_mode_t *wapi_mode)
00207 {
00208     switch (iw_mode)
00209     {
00210     case WAPI_MODE_AUTO:
00211     case WAPI_MODE_ADHOC:
00212     case WAPI_MODE_MANAGED:
00213     case WAPI_MODE_MASTER:
00214     case WAPI_MODE_REPEAT:
00215     case WAPI_MODE_SECOND:
00216     case WAPI_MODE_MONITOR:
00217         *wapi_mode = iw_mode;
00218         return 0;
00219 
00220     default:
00221         WAPI_ERROR("Unknown mode: %d.\n", iw_mode);
00222         return -1;
00223     }
00224 }

00227 int
00228 wapi_get_mode(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_mode_t *mode)
00229 {
00230     struct iwreq wrq;
00231     int ret;
00232 
00233     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00234     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWMODE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00235         ret = wapi_parse_mode(wrq.u.mode, mode);
00236     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWMODE);
00237 
00238     return ret;
00239 }

00277 int
00278 wapi_get_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, struct sockaddr *ap)
00279 {
00280     struct iwreq wrq;
00281     int ret;
00282 
00283     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00284     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWAP, &wrq)) >= 0)
00285         memcpy(ap, &(wrq.u.ap_addr), sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00286     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWAP);
00287 
00288     return ret;
00289 }
00290 
00291 
00292 int
00293 wapi_set_ap(int sock, const char *ifname, const struct sockaddr *ap)
00294 {
00295     struct iwreq wrq;
00296     int ret;
00297 
00298     /* Socket address must be of ARPHRD_ETHER family. */
00299     if (ap->sa_family != ARPHRD_ETHER)
00300         return -1;
00301 
00302     memcpy(&wrq.u.ap_addr, ap, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00303     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00304     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWAP, &wrq);
00305     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWAP);
00306 
00307     return ret;
00308 }

00320 int
00321 wapi_get_bitrate(
00322     int sock,
00323     const char *ifname,
00324     int *bitrate,
00325     wapi_bitrate_flag_t *flag)
00326 {
00327     struct iwreq wrq;
00328     int ret;
00329 
00330     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00331     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWRATE, &wrq)) >= 0)
00332     {
00333         /* Check if enabled. */
00334         if (wrq.u.bitrate.disabled)
00335         {
00336             WAPI_ERROR("Bitrate is disabled.\n");
00337             return -1;
00338         }
00339 
00340         /* Get bitrate. */
00341         *bitrate = wrq.u.bitrate.value;
00342         *flag = wrq.u.bitrate.fixed ? WAPI_BITRATE_FIXED : WAPI_BITRATE_AUTO;
00343     }
00344     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWRATE);
00345 
00346     return ret;
00347 }

00380 
00381 int
00382 wapi_dbm2mwatt(int dbm)
00383 {
00384     return floor(pow(10, (((double) dbm) / 10)));
00385 }
00386 
00387 
00388 int
00389 wapi_mwatt2dbm(int mwatt)
00390 {
00391     return ceil(10 * log10(mwatt));

00394 
00395 int
00396 wapi_get_txpower(
00397     int sock,
00398     const char *ifname,
00399     int *power,
00400     wapi_txpower_flag_t *flag)
00401 {
00402     struct iwreq wrq;
00403     int ret;
00404 
00405     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00406     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWTXPOW, &wrq)) >= 0)
00407     {
00408         /* Check if enabled. */
00409         if (wrq.u.txpower.disabled)
00410             return -1;
00411 
00412         /* Get flag. */
00413         if (IW_TXPOW_DBM == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_DBM))
00414             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM;
00415         else if (IW_TXPOW_MWATT == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_MWATT))
00416             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT;
00417         else if (IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE == (wrq.u.txpower.flags & IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE))
00418             *flag = WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE;
00419         else
00420         {
00421             WAPI_ERROR("Unknown flag: %d.\n", wrq.u.txpower.flags);
00422             return -1;
00423         }
00424 
00425         /* Get power. */
00426         *power = wrq.u.txpower.value;
00427     }
00428     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWTXPOW);
00429 
00430     return ret;
00431 }
00432 
00433 
00434 int
00435 wapi_set_txpower(
00436     int sock,
00437     const char *ifname,
00438     int power,
00439     wapi_txpower_flag_t flag)
00440 {
00441     struct iwreq wrq;
00442     int ret;
00443 
00444     /* Construct the request. */
00445     wrq.u.txpower.value = power;
00446     switch (flag)
00447     {
00448     case WAPI_TXPOWER_DBM:
00449         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_DBM;
00450         break;
00451     case WAPI_TXPOWER_MWATT:
00452         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_MWATT;
00453         break;
00454     case WAPI_TXPOWER_RELATIVE:
00455         wrq.u.txpower.flags = IW_TXPOW_RELATIVE;
00456         break;
00457     }
00458 
00459     /* Issue the set command. */
00460     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00461     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWTXPOW, &wrq);
00462     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWTXPOW);
00463 
00464     return ret;
00465 }

00471 struct iw_event_stream {
00472   char *end;        /* end of the stream */
00473   char *current;    /* current event in stream of events */
00474   char *value;      /* current value in event */
00475 };
00476 
00477 
00478 static void
00479 iw_event_stream_init(struct iw_event_stream *stream, char *data, size_t len)
00480 {
00481   memset(stream, 0, sizeof(struct iw_event_stream));
00482   stream->current = data;
00483   stream->end = &data[len];
00484 }
00485 
00486 
00487 static int
00488 iw_event_stream_pop(
00489     struct iw_event_stream *stream,
00490     struct iw_event *iwe,
00491     int we_version)
00492 {
00493     return iw_extract_event_stream(
00494         (struct stream_descr *) stream, iwe, we_version);
00495 }

00500 
00501 int
00502 wapi_scan_init(int sock, const char *ifname)
00503 {
00504     struct iwreq wrq;
00505     int ret;
00506 
00507     wrq.u.data.pointer = NULL;
00508     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00509     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00510 
00511     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00512     ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCSIWSCAN, &wrq);
00513     if (ret < 0) WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCSIWSCAN);
00514 
00515     return ret;
00516 }
00517 
00518 
00519 int
00520 wapi_scan_stat(int sock, const char *ifname)
00521 {
00522     struct iwreq wrq;
00523     int ret;
00524     char buf;
00525 
00526     wrq.u.data.pointer = &buf;
00527     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00528     wrq.u.data.length = 0;
00529 
00530     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00531     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0)
00532     {
00533         if (errno == E2BIG)
00534             /* Data is ready, but not enough space, which is expected. */
00535             return 0;
00536         else if (errno == EAGAIN)
00537             /* Data is not ready. */
00538             return 1;
00539 
00540         printf("err[%d]: %s\n", errno, strerror(errno));
00541     }
00542     else WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00543 
00544     return ret;
00545 }
00546 
00547 
00548 static int
00549 wapi_scan_event(struct iw_event *event, wapi_list_t *list)
00550 {
00551     wapi_scan_info_t *info;
00552 
00553     /* Validate "list" first.*/
00554     if (!list)
00555         return -1;
00556 
00557     /* Get current "wapi_info_t". */
00558     info = list->head.scan;
00559 
00560     /* Decode the event. */
00561     switch (event->cmd)
00562     {
00563     case SIOCGIWAP:
00564     {
00565         wapi_scan_info_t *temp;
00566 
00567         /* Allocate a new cell. */
00568         temp = malloc(sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00569         if (!temp)
00570         {
00571             WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00572             return -1;
00573         }
00574 
00575         /* Reset it. */
00576         bzero(temp, sizeof(wapi_scan_info_t));
00577 
00578         /* Save cell identifier */
00579         memcpy(&(temp->ap), &(event->u.ap_addr), sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00580 
00581         /* Push it to the head of the list. */
00582         temp->next = info;
00583         list->head.scan = temp;
00584         
00585         break;
00586     }
00587 
00588     case SIOCGIWFREQ:
00589         info->has_freq = 1;
00590         info->freq = wapi_freq2float(&(event->u.freq));
00591         break;
00592 
00593     case SIOCGIWMODE:
00594     {
00595         int ret = wapi_parse_mode(event->u.mode, &info->mode);
00596         if (ret >= 0)
00597         {
00598             info->has_mode = 1;
00599             break;
00600         }
00601         else return ret;
00602     }
00603 
00604     case SIOCGIWESSID:
00605         info->has_essid = 1;
00606         info->essid_flag = (event->u.data.flags) ? WAPI_ESSID_ON : WAPI_ESSID_OFF;
00607         memset(info->essid, 0, (WAPI_ESSID_MAX_SIZE + 1));
00608         if ((event->u.essid.pointer) && (event->u.essid.length))
00609             memcpy(info->essid, event->u.essid.pointer, event->u.essid.length);
00610         break;
00611 
00612     case SIOCGIWRATE:
00613         /* Scan may return a list of bitrates. As we have space for only a
00614          * single bitrate, we only keep the largest one. */
00615         if (!info->has_bitrate || event->u.bitrate.value > info->bitrate)
00616         {
00617             info->has_bitrate = 1;
00618             info->bitrate = event->u.bitrate.value;
00619         }
00620         break;
00621     }
00622 
00623     return 0;
00624 }
00625 
00626 
00627 int
00628 wapi_scan_coll(int sock, const char *ifname, wapi_list_t *aps)
00629 {
00630     char *buf;
00631     int buflen;
00632     struct iwreq wrq;
00633     int we_version;
00634     int ret;
00635 
00636     /* Validate "aps". */
00637     if (!aps)
00638     {
00639         WAPI_ERROR("Null wapi_list_t pointer!");
00640         return -1;
00641     }
00642 
00643     /* Get WE version. (Required for event extraction via libiw.) */
00644     if ((ret = wapi_get_we_version(sock, ifname, &we_version)) < 0)
00645         return ret;
00646 
00647     buflen = IW_SCAN_MAX_DATA;
00648     buf = malloc(buflen * sizeof(char));
00649     if (!buf)
00650     {
00651         WAPI_STRERROR("malloc()");
00652         return -1;
00653     }
00654 
00655 alloc:
00656     /* Collect results. */
00657     wrq.u.data.pointer = buf;
00658     wrq.u.data.length = buflen;
00659     wrq.u.data.flags = 0;
00660     strncpy(wrq.ifr_name, ifname, IFNAMSIZ);
00661     if ((ret = ioctl(sock, SIOCGIWSCAN, &wrq)) < 0 && errno == E2BIG)
00662     {
00663         char *tmp;
00664 
00665         buflen *= 2;
00666         tmp = realloc(buf, buflen);
00667         if (!tmp)
00668         {
00669             WAPI_STRERROR("realloc()");
00670             free(buf);
00671             return -1;
00672         }
00673 
00674         buf = tmp;
00675         goto alloc;
00676     }
00677 
00678     /* There is still something wrong. It's either EAGAIN or some other ioctl()
00679      * failure. We don't bother, let the user deal with it. */
00680     if (ret < 0)
00681     {
00682         WAPI_IOCTL_STRERROR(SIOCGIWSCAN);
00683         free(buf);
00684         return ret;
00685     }
00686 
00687     /* We have the results, process them. */
00688     if (wrq.u.data.length)
00689     {
00690         struct iw_event iwe;
00691         struct iw_event_stream stream;
00692 
00693         iw_event_stream_init(&stream, buf, wrq.u.data.length);
00694         do {
00695             if ((ret = iw_event_stream_pop(&stream, &iwe, we_version)) >= 0)
00696             {
00697                 int eventret = wapi_scan_event(&iwe, aps);
00698                 if (eventret < 0)
00699                     ret = eventret;
00700             }
00701             else WAPI_ERROR("iw_event_stream_pop() failed!\n");
00702         } while (ret > 0);
00703     }
00704 
00705     /* Free request buffer. */
00706     free(buf);
00707 
00708     return ret;
00709 }
